abstract: Slate’s Daniel Gross has a message for the bankers balking at proposals to reign in the size and scope of financial institutions and other reforms aimed at “forestalling a repeat of the panic of 2008″: If the banks want us out of their business, they should get out of our markets.
snippet: Slate’s Daniel Gross has a message for the bankers balking at proposals to reign in the size and scope of financial institutions and other reforms aimed at “forestalling a repeat of the panic of 2008″: If the banks want us out of their business, t...
lead_paragraph: Slate’s Daniel Gross has a message for the bankers balking at proposals to rein in the size and scope of financial institutions and other changes aimed at “forestalling a repeat of the panic of 2008″: If the banks want us out of their business, they should get out of our markets.

headline.main: Should Banks Get Out of Our Markets?

abstract: A new Steven Brill endeavor enables news outlets to charge their online readers. The tattered news industry may be ready to give it a whirl.
snippet: A new Steven Brill endeavor enables news outlets to charge their online readers. The tattered news industry may be ready to give it a whirl.
lead_paragraph: Extracting payment from online readers has been called everything from the next great folly of print journalism to its salvation, but to get a glimpse of how it really looks, head to Lancaster, Pa.

headline.main: Some News Outlets Ready to Try Charging Online Readers
headline.print_headline: Some Newspapers Prepare To Charge for Web Access
